description: Alteration to roof involving raising ridge height; rear dormer roof extension; installation of four rooflights to front and side roof slopes; Removal of inner chimney stack, demolition of existing rear conservatory; single storey rear extension and associated internal and external alteration.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): MON/24/FP/01 (Site location Plan), MON/24/FP/01.1 (Site/block plan proposed), MON/24/FP/02 (existing ground and first floor), MON/24/FP/03 (existing second floor and roof plan), MON/24/FP/04 (existing elevations), MON/24/FP/05 (existing back and side elevations), MON/24/FP/06 (existing section AA), MON/24/FP/07 Rev C (proposed ground and first floor plans), MON/24/FP/08 Rev C (Proposed second floor and roof plan), MON/24/FP/09 Rev C (proposed front and side elevations), MON/24/FP/010 Rev C (proposed back and side elevations), MON/24/FP/01.11 Rev C (proposed section AA).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| The hereby approved ^IN; rooflights to the roof slope of the hereby development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
